node.title: Neural Network Intelligence (NNI)
node.excerpt: On the cutting edge of AI projects, NNI is an open-source AutoML development. Allowing access to all major AI frameworks, NNI is a unique offering for Data Science teams adding an AI practice.
node.custom_excerpt: On the cutting edge of AI projects, NNI is an open-source AutoML development. Allowing access to all major AI frameworks, NNI is a unique offering for Data Science teams adding an AI practice.

tags.description: Experience deploying cloud first application architecture and workforce platforms across Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and others cloud platforms. Interest in AI/ML ethically on the edge, energy efficient compute, and empowering change and access through technology.
tags.meta_description: Talking about deploying content to the cloud! Clean compute, private ML models, and more.

node.plaintext:
Tools for AutoML and Beyond
 * Rich and comprehensive toolkit
    * all major frameworks
    * 28 popular AutoML algorithms
   
   
 * Expanding functionalities and coverage
   

Demo of NNI Fundamentals
This is a mature project with wonderful tooling, desirable features like an
established container approach, GUI, verbose CLI, and support for any major
framework you desire.
node.html:
Tools for AutoML and Beyond

  • Rich and comprehensive toolkit

    • all major frameworks
    • 28 popular AutoML algorithms

  • Expanding functionalities and coverage

Demo of NNI Fundamentals

This is a mature project with wonderful tooling, desirable features like an established container approach, GUI, verbose CLI, and support for any major framework you desire.

node.title: Health Taxonomy: NLP to Understand Health Research
node.excerpt: Google Cloud Next talk showing Natural Language Processing API usage for legal document categorization. Addresses systemic challenges in developing production AI, with a focus on healthcare considerations.
node.custom_excerpt: Google Cloud Next talk showing Natural Language Processing API usage for legal document categorization. Addresses systemic challenges in developing production AI, with a focus on healthcare considerations.
node.meta_title: Adding AI to the Healthcare toolbox
node.meta_description: Alex Welcing encourages team building for equitable AI at Google Cloud Next 2018, with a practical example from healthcare showing how NLP can save precious time.

tags.name: Google Cloud
tags.description: The black sheep of cloud development, Google Cloud trails AWS and Azure in adoption. But, the UI is slick and I can build everything I need from a Chromebook using Cloud Shell. Eventually, enterprises will consider spending money here as well.

tags.name: Presentation
tags.description: You know, when you have to convince someone your idea makes sense before moving forward. Present your thinking or win new business, the act of presentation is a critically undervalued technical capability.

node.plaintext:
Thanks to everyone who had a chance to attend in person or explore this
presentation post Cloud Next '18.  Democratizing AI is more important than ever,
and I am always open to questions or collaboration. Here is the video and
presentation slides.

node.title: Give them PROOF
node.excerpt: When a model that performs successfully learns a new task, performance on the previous task can drop. The research on Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting seeks to address this problem.
node.custom_excerpt: When a model that performs successfully learns a new task, performance on the previous task can drop. The research on Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting seeks to address this problem.
node.meta_description: AI successfully learns a new task, but then performance on an earlier task can drop. Research on Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting addresses this problem.
node.twitter_description: AI successfully learns a new task, but then performance on an earlier task can drop. Research on Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting addresses this problem.

tags.description: Why think when the computer could handle it for you?

node.plaintext:
A data scientist or machine teacher might reasonably be expected to answer the
question 

> "How do we know what led the machine to reach each decision?"
This feels like a fair request to ask of a neural net that could decide if your
tires stay on the road, the length of criminal sentences and the composition of
prescription medications. 
It's so clear when you explain it like that.Much like humans, however, the more
we learn about the way they work the more confident experts are in asserting the
vastness of the undiscovered. 

We are flawed decision makers, teaching our invention based on data from our
flawed past. As we pour resources into the new age of computation, let us teach
first from our mistakes, the ways we err'ed, mistreated each other, and made
systems that are incapable of distributing resources to meet need. That is why
the paper on teaching models to avoid forgetfulness behaviors was so promising.

You can read "Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting " here: 
https://arxiv.org/pdf/1902.08232.pdf
node.html:
A data scientist or machine teacher might reasonably be expected to answer the question

"How do we know what led the machine to reach each decision?"

This feels like a fair request to ask of a neural net that could decide if your tires stay on the road, the length of criminal sentences and the composition of prescription medications.

Much like humans, however, the more we learn about the way they work the more confident experts are in asserting the vastness of the undiscovered.

We are flawed decision makers, teaching our invention based on data from our flawed past. As we pour resources into the new age of computation, let us teach first from our mistakes, the ways we err'ed, mistreated each other, and made systems that are incapable of distributing resources to meet need. That is why the paper on teaching models to avoid forgetfulness behaviors was so promising.

You can read "Overcoming Multi-model Forgetting " here: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1902.08232.pdf
